data.title: Spine: issue with scheduleUpdate
data.body:
Hi everyone.
I found a problem with latest version of **CCSkeleton.cpp**.

When you create a new Spine instance it calling **scheduleUpdate** method on **onEner** event.
It's okay, but when you using **javascript bindings** and wants to control update method from **javascript** there are some issue because **update** method in **javascript** is never calling because scheduleUpdate was called from c++.

Any way when you trying to call **scheduleUpdate** from javascript **it calling TWICE (once from c++ and once from javascript)**, so even the spine animation running two times faster.

This issue related to the https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-js/issues/1732, but today I know why it happens. I don't know exactly what I shoud do with it so I trying to find the solution with community.

Thank you!

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.title: Sprite3D Attribute not found: a_normal
data.body:
Exported 3d model from Blender produces this warning if there are no lights in the scene

cocos2d: warning: Attribute not found: a_normal

It happens because model contains normals, but if there are no light sources in the scene, shader that doesn't have normals will be used and this warning will pop up, when trying to bind attributes.

data.title: quick 3.3 or 3.5 trans to cocos2d-x 3.7 rc1
data.body:
I create a lua HelloWorld project by running "cocos new MyLuaGame -p com.yourcompany.mygame -l lua -d MyLuaGame" with the newest cocos2d-x . I copy framework of quick 3.5 to my HelloWorld Project, and replace app directory , main.lua, config.lua with the sample code in mvc, when i run the project, it said : [LUA ERROR] [string "src/framework/cocos2dx/NodeEx.lua"]:278: attempt to call a nil value. I do not known why.  Is that the newest cocos2d-x was not adapted to quick ? How can i  fixed it ?

this is my project:
localhost:MyLuaGame Wade$ ls
config.json frameworks  res     runtime     src
localhost:MyLuaGame Wade$ cd frameworks/
localhost:frameworks Wade$ ls
CMakeLists.txt  cocos2d-x   runtime-src
localhost:frameworks Wade$ cd ..
localhost:MyLuaGame Wade$ cd src
localhost:src Wade$ ls
app     cocos       config.lua  framework   main.lua
localhost:src Wade$ cd cocos/
localhost:cocos Wade$ ls
3d      cocosdenshion   extension   network     ui
cocos2d     cocostudio  framework   physics3d
cocosbuilder    controller  init.lua    spine
localhost:cocos Wade$ cd ..
localhost:src Wade$ cd framework/
localhost:framework Wade$ ls
anysdkConst.lua cocos2dx.lua    device.lua  global.lua  luaoc.lua   shortcodes.lua
audio.lua   crypto.lua  display.lua init.lua    network.lua toluaEx.lua
cc      debug.lua   filter.lua  json.lua    platform    transition.lua
cocos2dx    deprecated  functions.lua   luaj.lua    scheduler.lua

data.title: cocosui folder not found on ubuntu when running test
data.body:
working on implementation of AudioEngine for linux. when running the test NewAudioEngine on Ubuntu, I got this error and some UI sprites are not shown: 
 cocos2d: fullPathForFilename: No file found at cocosui/sliderTrack.png. Possible missing file.
cocos2d: fullPathForFilename: No file found at cocosui/sliderThumb.png. Possible missing file.
cocos2d: fullPathForFilename: No file found at cocosui/sliderThumb.png. Possible missing file.
cocos2d: fullPathForFilename: No file found at cocosui/sliderProgress.png. Possible missing file.
I solved it by creating a symbolic link named cocosui pointing to "extensions", but wonder what is the right approach.

data.title: [cocos2d-js] Cc.EditBox show virtual keyboard automatically
data.body:
Implement a method on cc.EditBox to show the virtual keyboard. Similar to ccui.TextField.attachWithIME().

First I thought that I can use this:

```
 cc.director.getOpenGLView().setIMEKeyboardState(true);
```

it does open the keyboard but the focus is not in the EditBox

so I've ended up with this DIRTY trick:

```
 void MyHelpCppClass::showVirtualKeyboard (bool open, EditBox* editBox) const
 {
      editBox->touchDownAction(NULL, Widget::TouchEventType::ENDED);
 }
```

which is called from JS using JSB. Sad, but working... at least for now.

Any proper solution would still be appreciated, thanks.
